result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jake Ellis King

defendant.name: King, Jake Ellis
defendant.address: N1850 County Rd U, Plum City, WI 54761

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter from Attorney Petersen Re: Consolidation of Cases of 20CF17 and 22CF06 into Dunn Co. case.

records.descr: Application for consolidation of criminal charges

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court's response to Attorney Petersen's letter - Quash the warrant.  Judge Rohl may assume jurisdiction over any case involving Mr. King.
Letter from Petersen Law Firm Re: Warrant

02:17 PM  Mr. King appeared on 4/5 and was given the AIA for today on 5/3, he fails to appear and provide any reason for his f/t/a.  Warrant requested by the State and authorized by the court for failure to appear.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:32 PM Defendant Jake Ellis King appeared by zoom technology by phone means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. King tried to contact the PD office.  Mr. King employed with Bauer Concrete but touch and go due to the weather.  Work less than 20 hours per week at $20/hr.  Attorney Patek requests Mr. King to contact the PD office again and requests to return on 5/3.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:23 PM Defendant Jake Ellis King appeared by zoom technology by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant needs time to speak to an attorney.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:34 PM Defendant Jake Ellis King appeared by zoom technology by video means from the Pepin County Jail. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Here on a bail hearing.  The procedure is Mr. Seifert will inform the Court what he's looking for and then you may speak.  Attorney Seifert, Mr. King is charged with 5 counts count 1, possession of meth, class I felony, count 2, possession of controlled substance, a misdemeanor, count 3, possession of drug paraphernalia, a misdeameanor, count 4, felony bail jumping for Pepin Co. Case 20CF17, count 5, felony bail jumping case 21CF187 so those are the 5 charges.  Mr. King was already out on bail on 2 cases, Pepin and Dunn County.  As a result of these new charges and the allegations come at a time when Mr. King was already on bond in 2 separate counties and ask for cash bond of $1000.00.  Court inquires of the bond on the other cases for Pepin and Dunn County.  State does not have the information available and asks the clerk assist in getting that information.  Court inquires if Mr. King has always shown up for his hearings.  Yes sir.  In Dunn County is appears you showed up for all of those hearings and in Pepin County you have  shown up for all hearings except for an Arraignment and called in saying he was having trouble.  Cash bond set of $2500 on Pepin Co. case.  Court inquires of Mr. Seifert if we can use the cash bond of $2500 in this case as well.  Mr. Seifert informs they could but looking at forfeiting that bond.  Court orders $1000 signature bond with standard conditions, no possession of any illegal drugs without a prescription and follow all laws.  Nothing further requested by the State.  Also appear for all hearings.  New court date 2/15 at 1:30 pm.  Mr. King informs he starts a job that day.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
